title: designed to fire only blanks, irritants, other active substances or pyrotechnic
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities (Alarm
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities (Alarm 

and Signal Weapons) (Technical Specifications) Regulations 2022. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european community (alarm signal weapons) (technical specifications) regulation 2022 interpretation

heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations –

title: designed to fire only blanks, irritants, other active substances or pyrotechnic
heading: 3. (1) The Minister may appoint such and so many officers of the Minister
text_raw:
3. (1) The Minister may appoint such and so many officers of the Minister 
as he or she thinks fit to be authorised officers for the purposes of these 
Regulations. 

(2) The Minister shall furnish an authorised officer with a warrant of his or 
her appointment and, when exercising a power conferred by these Regulations, 

1 OJ L 15, 17.1.2019, p. 22. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 19th April, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [180] 3 

the authorised officer shall, if requested by a person affected, produce the 
warrant, or a copy of it, to that person for inspection. 

(3) The Minister may terminate the appointment of an authorised officer 

whether or not the appointment was for a fixed period. 

(4) The appointment of an authorised officer ceases – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

if it is terminated under paragraph (3), 

if it is for a fixed period, on the expiry of that period, or 

upon the person ceasing to be an officer of the Minister. 

Inspection of devices

title: designed to fire only blanks, irritants, other active substances or pyrotechnic
heading: 4. (1) An authorised officer may inspect a device for the purpose of –
text_raw:
4. (1) An authorised officer may inspect a device for the purpose of – 

(a) determining whether the device is or is not an alarm and signal 

weapon, and 

(b) where the authorised officer determines, in accordance with 

paragraph (a), that the device – 

(i) 

is an alarm and signal weapon – 

(I) 

further determining whether the alarm and signal 
weapon concerned complies or does not comply with 
the technical specifications, and 

(II) ascertaining 

the 

in 
information 
subparagraphs (ii) to (vii) of paragraph (c) of 
Regulation 5, 

referred 

to 

or 

(ii) 

is not an alarm and signal weapon, ascertaining the 
information referred to in subparagraphs (i) to (vi) of 
paragraph (d) of Regulation 5. 

Recording information in database

title: designed to fire only blanks, irritants, other active substances or pyrotechnic
heading: 6. The Department is designated as the national focal point for the purposes
text_raw:
6. The Department is designated as the national focal point for the purposes 

of Article 3 of the Commission Implementing Directive. 

Establishing and maintaining database
text_norm: 6 department designated national focal point purpose article 3 commission implementing directive establishing maintaining database

title: designed to fire only blanks, irritants, other active substances or pyrotechnic
heading: 7. (1) The Department shall establish and maintain a database for the
text_raw:
7. (1) The Department shall establish and maintain a database for the 

purpose of recording, in relation to a particular device – 

(a) 

(b) 

the information referred to in paragraphs (a) to (e) of Regulation 
5, and 

the information received from the national focal point of another 
Member State in response to a request made by the State in 
accordance with Article 3 of the Commission Implementing 
Directive. 

(2) The database may be established and maintained in paper or electronic 

form. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [180] 5 

Request for information from another Member State relating to a device

title: designed to fire only blanks, irritants, other active substances or pyrotechnic
heading: 8. Where –
text_raw:
8. Where – 

(a) 

(b) 

another Member State requests, in accordance with Article 3 of 
the Commission Implementing Directive, information from the 
Department relating to a particular device, and 

the information referred to in paragraphs (a) to (e) of Regulation 
5 in relation to that device has, in accordance with that 
Regulation, been entered in the database, 

the Department shall provide the requesting Member State with a copy of the 
information so entered as soon as practicable after the request is made. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

11 April, 2022. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice.
